summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between a prosecutor's office (USANYS) and defense attorney Patricia Anne Pileggi regarding a subpoena to Mar-a-Lago for employment records and a records custodian. The emails discuss efforts to locate former HR directors and obtain contact information for compliance with the subpoena, which calls for an appearance on November 29, 2021.

persons.name: Patricia Anne Pileggi
persons.context: Attorney communicating with the US Attorney's Office (USANYS) regarding a subpoena to Mar-a-Lago for employment records and arranging for a records custodian.

persons.name: Jill Martin
persons.role: Compliance Counsel for the Trump Organization
persons.context: Identified as compliance counsel for the Trump Organization, handling matters for Mar-a-Lago; she provided information about former HR directors and is a point of contact for records.

connections.description: Pileggi communicates with Martin, who is compliance counsel for the Trump Organization, to obtain information and coordinate regarding the Mar-a-Lago subpoena.
Pileggi corresponds with prosecutors from the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the issuance and compliance with a trial subpoena to Mar-a-Lago.

events.title: Scheduled appearance for Mar-a-Lago records custodian
events.description: The subpoena calls for someone from Mar-a-Lago to appear on November 29, 2021, with employment records.

events.title: Reference to HR Director prior to 2007
events.description: Mention that the Director of Human Resources prior to 2007 is no longer with Mar-a-Lago, indicating a timeframe relevant to the records sought.

events.title: Reference to employment at Mar-a-Lago in 2000
events.description: Note that no one has been located who recalls working at Mar-a-Lago in 2000, indicating the investigation is seeking information from that period.

keyFacts: A trial subpoena was issued to Mar-a-Lago for employment records and required a records custodian to appear on November 29, 2021.
The Director of Human Resources prior to 2007 is no longer with Mar-a-Lago, and efforts were made to obtain their contact information.
Jill Martin is identified as compliance counsel for the Trump Organization and the point of contact for Mar-a-Lago regarding the subpoena.
The document indicates the investigation is seeking records related to employment at Mar-a-Lago, including from the year 2000.
The correspondence is between the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and defense attorney Patricia Anne Pileggi.
